title: Done with chemo, Craig Sager to work Pelicans-Warriors game on NBA opening night for TNT
text:
By Matt Bonesteel October 17 at 4:52 PM Follow @MattBonesteel (Tannen Maury/EPA) 
Earlier this month, Craig Sager Jr. announced on Twitter that his father, longtime NBA announcer Craig Sager Sr., would be leaving the hospital early after his latest round of chemotherapy. Sager Sr. has been battling leukemia: 18 days early, on Day 82, Sr. has been cleared & is coming home for good WHAT A FIGHT! Thank you MD Anderson & everyone that believed in him 
â€” Craig Sager II (@CraigSagerJr) October 7, 2015 
And now comes more good news: TNT announced Friday that Sager, 64, will be back at work on NBA opening night, working the sideline at the Pelicans-Warriors game on Oct. 27. 
Thinking that his leukemia was in full remission after his initial treatment, Sager returned to the TNT sideline in March. But he was forced to step down again later that month after the cancer returned.
